intro: Aphyllodium parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved featherplant, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
